document_metadata.title: Multi-Scale RCNN Model for Financial Time-series Classification

base_methods.evidence_text: Existing FTC research can be categorized into MS-oriented and TD-oriented methods. However, few studies effectively integrate both properties.

compared_methods.method_name: Support Vector Machine (SVM), Random Forest (RF), Fuzzy Deep Neural Network (FDNN), TreNet, State-Frequency Memory Recurrent Neural Networks (SFM), Multi-Scale CNN (MS-CNN)
compared_methods.comparison_result: Our MSTD-RCNN model is compared with six baseline models on three datasets. The results, listed in Table 5, show that our model achieves the best performance in accuracy and F1.
compared_methods.evidence_text: Our MSTD-RCNN model is compared with six baseline models on three datasets.

datasets_used.dataset_description: Data spans from January 1, 2016, to December 30, 2016, with a total of 58,000 data points.
datasets_used.evidence_text: We describe the datasets from the Chinese stock market: SH000001, SZ399005, and SZ399006.

quantitative_results.evidence_text: Our model effectively extracts MS features and captures Temporal Dependency (TD) within financial time-series.

stated_contributions: A novel method combining both MS and TD properties in financial time-series.
MS feature extraction with convolutional units without predefined parameters.
Fusion of different scale features using a Recurrent Neural Network to capture temporal dependencies.
stated_advantages: State-of-the-art performance in trend classification and simulated trading on Chinese stock market datasets.

warnings: 可疑技术关系method_name: Multi-Scale (MS) methods, TD-oriented methods
可疑技术关系evidence_text: Existing FTC research can be categorized into MS-oriented and TD-oriented methods. However, few studies effectively integrate both properties.
